result.execSummary:
The defendant John D. Severson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.
  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $500 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:10 p.m. Defendant John D. Severson in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1, 4 & 5 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Cts 2, 3 & 6 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Goldin. No statement by DE. Court orders: Ct 1 - S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: 7 mos WCJ - Huber, No GT, 3 days CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than 4/1/2015, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Ct 4 - 6 mos WCJ - Huber, GT, 3 days CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation concurrent w/ Ct 1 - Conditions same as Ct 1 w/o jail time. Ct 5 - S/W - 3 yrs probation concurrent w/ Cts 1 & 4 - Conditions same as Ct 1 w/o jail time. Bond previously posted to be applied. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 13, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on January 20, 2015 at 10:20 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Matthew Loren Goldin in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Goldin requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 10:20 am.
Status conference on December 15, 2014 at 02:35 pm.

1:28 pm case called. Attorney Matthew Loren Goldin in court.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Preliminary hearing and time limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive the right to a preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause a felony has been comitted within the courts jurisdiction and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Goldin confirms receipt and waives further reading and enters pleas of Not Guilty.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 02:35 pm.
State's
Initial appearance on November 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:32 p.m. Defendant John D. Severson in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $1000 Cash Bond. Atty Patzer requesting lower cash bond. Court orders $500 Cash Bond.   IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. DA Blader raises a possible conflict that may exist as he previously represented the defendant.  Initial appearance scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
